job_title: Junior Business Manager in Kiev, Kyiv
pros: I am communicative, friendly, openedto new information and learning.
Quite a technically educated team. Many professionals.
cons: Weak funding from the Ministry of Education. There are practically no private investors. Almost all employees are pensioners.
too many hours, very bureaucratic structure

review_title: One of the best technical education places in Ukraine
pros: Multidisciplinary, good for collaboration. Doubled salary (but still low) and good possibilities to grow: post-doctoral programs, academic mobility. In some cases, you may combine this employment with other company (or institution).
cons: "Death Valley" for young employers is too long - you have to be ready to work 5-7 years for a salary below average. The competition with older staff is not always honest and the workload is usually non-proportional. The level of bureaucracy sometimes is too high: to agree on some decisions you have to gather 12-16 signatures of responsible persons, which work in different buildings and have some strange working hours. So, to start a contract you have to spend a month on al this. That demotes and turns ambitious youngsters to discouraged lazy clerks.

review_title: One of the best universities in Ukraine
pros: This University gave me a lot. Even despite it's not my Alma Mater, I very appreciate all my colleagues and management board to give my an opportunity to build myself here as a scientist and manager. Smart students make this job even better.
cons: There are few. Old buildings and communications.
